page.title: 18CRAMOND :Residents' Opinions
page.content: {Cramond is a desirable residential area. Most people come here for the amenities of a garden suburb and for the location as houses are near the airport,Glasgow motorway,Forth Road Bridge and the centre of Edinburgh. People who moved here for the peace and quiet don't find it peaceful enough as road and air traffic are noisy problems. The rates are the residents' only other source of annoyance. Mostly the houses are pleasant detached buildings in their own gardens and the local schools are known as excellent centres of education. Most residents have one or two cars. There are plenty of petrol stations. For those without cars transport is difficult with only one regular bus passing through. There is a demand for a better provision. Shopping facilities could be better.
